javax.portlet

Interface ConditionalDispatcher


  • public interface ConditionalDispatcher
    This interface provides methods to be implemented in order to implement conditional method dispatching.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<MethodToken> dispatch(HeaderRequest request, HeaderResponse response, Map<HeaderMethod,MethodToken> methods)
      Called by the portlet container when an @HeaderMethod annotated method is to be dispatched.
      List<MethodToken> dispatch(RenderRequest request, RenderResponse response, Map<RenderMethod,MethodToken> methods)
      Called by the portlet container when an @RenderMethod annotated method is to be dispatched.
      List<MethodToken> dispatch(ResourceRequest request, ResourceResponse response, Map<ServeResourceMethod,MethodToken> methods)
      Called by the portlet container when an @ServeResourceMethod annotated method is to be dispatched.

    • Method Detail

      • dispatch

        List<MethodToken> dispatch(RenderRequest request,
                         RenderResponse response,
                         Map<RenderMethod,MethodToken> methods)
                           throws IOException,
                                  PortletException
        Called by the portlet container when an @RenderMethod annotated method is to be dispatched.

        The method should analyze the annotations based on the current request and create a list of method tokens representing the methods to be invoked. The list may be empty. A given method token may appear more than once in the list.

        If the method returns a non-null List object, the portlet container will invoke the methods in the order they appear in the list, and then perform no further dispatching operation for the current request.

        If the method returns null, the portlet container will dispatch the method using its implementation-specific or default algorithm.

        If the method throws an exception, it will be treated as an unhandled exception during render request processing. The portlet container will perform no further dispatching.

        Parameters:
        request - The render render request
        response - The render render response
        methods - A Map containing the @RenderMethod as keys and corresponding method tokens as values.
        Returns:
        A list of method tokens if the dispatch has been handled. The list may be empty. null if the portlet container is to continue with dispatching.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs
        PortletException - If an unexpected condition arises
        See Also:
        MethodToken, RenderMethod

      • dispatch

        List<MethodToken> dispatch(HeaderRequest request,
                         HeaderResponse response,
                         Map<HeaderMethod,MethodToken> methods)
                           throws IOException,
                                  PortletException
        Called by the portlet container when an @HeaderMethod annotated method is to be dispatched.

        The method should analyze the annotations based on the current request and create a list of method tokens representing the methods to be invoked. The list may be empty. A given method token may appear more than once in the list.

        If the method returns a non-null List object, the portlet container will invoke the methods in the order they appear in the list, and then perform no further dispatching operation for the current request.

        If the method returns null, the portlet container will dispatch the method using its implementation-specific or default algorithm.

        If the method throws an exception, it will be treated as an unhandled exception during header request processing. The portlet container will perform no further dispatching.

        Parameters:
        request - The header request
        response - The header response
        methods - A Map containing the @HeaderMethod as keys and corresponding method tokens as values.
        Returns:
        A list of method tokens if the dispatch has been handled. The list may be empty. null if the portlet container is to continue with dispatching.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs
        PortletException - If an unexpected condition arises
        See Also:
        MethodToken, HeaderMethod

      • dispatch

        List<MethodToken> dispatch(ResourceRequest request,
                         ResourceResponse response,
                         Map<ServeResourceMethod,MethodToken> methods)
                           throws IOException,
                                  PortletException
        Called by the portlet container when an @ServeResourceMethod annotated method is to be dispatched.

        The method should analyze the annotations based on the current request and create a list of method tokens representing the methods to be invoked. The list may be empty. A given method token may appear more than once in the list.

        If the method returns a non-null List object, the portlet container will invoke the methods in the order they appear in the list, and then perform no further dispatching operation for the current request.

        If the method returns null, the portlet container will dispatch the method using its implementation-specific or default algorithm.

        If the method throws an exception, it will be treated as an unhandled exception during resource request processing. The portlet container will perform no further dispatching.

        Parameters:
        request - The resource request
        response - The resource response
        methods - A Map containing the @ServeResourceMethod as keys and corresponding method tokens as values.
        Returns:
        A list of method tokens if the dispatch has been handled. The list may be empty. null if the portlet container is to continue with dispatching.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs
        PortletException - If an unexpected condition arises
        See Also:
        MethodToken, ServeResourceMethod
